alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 12:49PM PST until December 26 at 8:15PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The river will recede this afternoon, and flooding will slowly abate. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...No additional flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Skokomish River will locally spill over its banks into low-lying areas of the Skokomish Valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.4 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river crested at 16.65 feet at 645 this morning and fell below flood stage at 1115. Flooding will contiue a little while longer until the flood wave has passed downstream out of the area. The river is expected to continue to fall the next couple of days but rise again below flood stage Thursday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 815 PM PST.
